member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.HeartbeatEventArgs.IsWarmupComplete
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the warm-up period is complete.
member.returns: true if the warm-up interval is complete; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.ICounterProvider
member.summary: Defines an interface that an implementation of the interface can use to obtain the current values of performance counters, other than the performance counter being tested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.ICounterProvider.GetCounterValue(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the current value of a performance counter.
member.returns: A object.
member.param: The name of the computer from which the performance counter value is collected.
The category name of the performance counter.
The name of the performance counter.
The name of the instance of the performance counter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.ILoadTestPlugin
member.summary: Defines an interface that is implemented to allow a user written class to handle events that occur as the load test, and the tests contained within the load test, are run.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.ILoadTestPlugin.Initialize(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTest)
member.summary: Initializes the load test plug-in.
member.param: The load test to be executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.InvalidLoadProfileException
member.summary: This class represents an Exception that occurs when a load test plug-in attempts to assign the property of the to a with an invalid or inconsistent set of property values.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.InvalidLoadProfileException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.InvalidLoadProfileException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.
member.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to make sure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.InvalidLoadProfileException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to make sure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.IThresholdRule
member.summary: Used to monitor the values of performance counters during a load test run to signal warnings or critical alarms when the value of a performance counters exceeds a threshold.

member.summary: Checks the value of one or more counter samples against a threshold and returns a result that indicates the status of the counter relative to the threshold parameters specified by the rule parameters.
member.returns: A enumeration.
member.param: The computed value of a performance counter.
Provides information about performance counter values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.IThresholdRule.ViolationMessage
member.summary: Gets a message describing a rule violation.
member.returns: A message describing a rule violation.

member.summary: Represents the load profile of a load test that has a goal-based load pattern.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.CategoryName
member.summary: Gets or sets a performance counter category to monitor.
member.returns: The name of the performance counter category to monitor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.CounterName
member.summary: Gets or sets the performance counter to monitor.
member.returns: The name of the performance counter to monitor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.GetLoad(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the user load that should be used at the current time in the load test based on the value of elapsedSeconds since the start of the load test passed as an argument.
member.param: The time, in seconds, since the start of the load test.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.HigherValuesBetter
member.summary: Set this Boolean value to True when the performance counter specified by the Category and Counter properties is a performance counter for which a lower value indicates higher utilization of a resource.
member.returns: True if a lower value indicates higher utilization; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.InitialUserCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial user count. This is the number of virtual users to run at the start of the load test before the user load is adjusted, based on the specified goal.
member.returns: The initial user count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.InstanceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the performance counter instance to monitor.
member.returns: The performance counter instance to monitor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MachineName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the computer to monitor.
member.returns: The name of the computer to monitor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MaxTargetValue
member.summary: Gets or sets an upper limit to target. Load is increased or decreased to keep the counter below this value.
member.returns: The upper limit to target.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MaxUserCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum user count. The load cannot not exceed this value after the goal is met.
member.returns: The maximum user count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MaxUserCountDecrease
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount by which to reduce the user load.
member.returns: The maximum amount by which to reduce the user load.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MaxUserCountIncrease
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount by which to increase the user load.
member.returns: The maximum amount by which to increase the user load.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MinTargetValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit to target for the goal-based load pattern.
member.returns: The lower limit to target.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.MinUserCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum user count. The load cannot go below this value even to satisfy the goal.
member.returns: The minimum user count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.StopAdjustingAtGoal
member.summary: True indicates to stop adjusting user load. False indicates that the test must continue to adjust the user load throughout the test if needed to keep the specified performance counter value within the target range.
member.returns: True if the running test has stopped adjusting the user load. False if the running test will continue to adjust user load throughout the test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.LoadTesting.LoadTestGoalBasedLoadProfile.Validate
member.summary: Throws an InvalidLoadProfileException if the LoadProfile object has invalid or inconsistent properties. It also displays an appropriate message.
